intro: Schefflera coriacea, commonly known as the rough-leaved schefflera, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically arranged in a whorl at the ends of the stems. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its leaves are thick and leathery, with a rough texture that gives it its common name. Schefflera coriacea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
